title: Biohazard Quarantine Zone Adventure #46
goal: Solve the puzzles, achieve the main objective, and escape.

rooms.name: Decontamination Airlock
rooms.description: A sterile white chamber with harsh fluorescent lighting. Warning signs flash red on the walls: BIOHAZARD LEVEL 4 - CONTAINMENT BREACH. Decontamination showers line one wall, and hazmat suits hang on hooks. The air smells of disinfectant and ozone. Emergency klaxons echo in the distance.

items.name: hazmat equipment locker
items.description: A tall metal locker containing protective gear and emergency supplies

items.name: facility operations manual
items.description: A laminated manual with emergency procedures
items.text: APEX BIOCONTAINMENT FACILITY - Established 2047. Director: Dr. Sarah Chen. Lead Virologist: Dr. Marcus Webb. In case of containment breach, all personnel must evacuate through the Emergency Evacuation Bay. Pathogen samples stored in Research Laboratory.

items.name: emergency respirator mask
items.description: A protective mask with fresh filters

items.name: security checkpoint desk
items.description: A desk with monitors showing facility status and a locked drawer

items.name: level two security keycard
items.description: A magnetic keycard labeled RESEARCH LAB ACCESS

items.name: biohazard warning poster
items.description: A large poster with safety protocols and facility information
items.text: BIOHAZARD SAFETY PROTOCOLS: All personnel must wear protective equipment. Pathogen samples are stored in secure containment in the Research Laboratory. The combination to secure storage is the year this facility was established: 2047.

items.name: wall mounted terminal
items.description: A computer terminal displaying facility status
items.text: SYSTEM STATUS: Containment breach detected in Research Laboratory. Pathogen: Experimental Virus Strain X. Source: Research Laboratory Sample Storage. All personnel evacuate immediately. You are a Research Scientist assigned to this facility.

items.name: decontamination shower
items.description: An automated shower system for removing contamination

items.name: handwritten emergency note
items.description: A note hastily written on waterproof paper
items.text: If you're reading this, get to the Research Lab and find the secure storage key. The Containment Control Room has the only working emergency exit. You'll need to prove you know the facility details to unlock it. - Dr. Chen

items.name: research laboratory door
items.description: A heavy airlock door with a card reader and biohazard warnings. Red lights flash around the frame.

rooms.name: Research Laboratory
rooms.description: A state of the art laboratory in chaos. Broken containment vessels leak glowing green liquid. Microscopes and equipment are overturned. Specimen freezers line the walls, some with doors hanging open. Emergency lights cast everything in an eerie red glow. Biohazard symbols are everywhere.

items.name: main research workstation
items.description: A lab bench covered with notes, samples, and equipment

items.name: research lab journal
items.description: Dr. Webb's research journal with recent entries
items.text: Day 47: Virus Strain X is more aggressive than anticipated. Dr. Chen has ordered all samples secured in the Research Laboratory containment units. The key to secure storage is hidden in the specimen freezer. If containment fails, evacuation through the Emergency Evacuation Bay is the only option.

items.name: specimen storage freezer
items.description: A large freezer unit with frost covering the door

items.name: secure storage key
items.description: A key labeled SECURE CONTAINMENT STORAGE

items.name: broken containment unit
items.description: A shattered glass containment chamber with green residue
items.text: WARNING: Containment Unit 7 - Virus Strain X. Status: BREACHED. Source of contamination identified. Pathogen origin: Research Laboratory Sample Storage.

items.name: secure storage cabinet
items.description: A reinforced cabinet with a heavy lock and biohazard markings

items.name: full body hazmat suit
items.description: A complete protective suit required for safe evacuation

items.name: evacuation procedures document
items.description: Official evacuation instructions
items.text: EMERGENCY EVACUATION PROTOCOL: In case of containment breach, proceed to Containment Control Room. Emergency exit requires security verification. Questions verify: 1) Facility name? 2) Contamination source location? 3) Your role designation?

items.name: laboratory computer terminal
items.description: A terminal displaying research data and facility information
items.text: APEX BIOCONTAINMENT FACILITY DATABASE: Current research projects include Virus Strain X pathogen studies. All Research Scientists must follow safety protocols. Director Dr. Chen oversees all operations from Containment Control Room.

items.name: electron microscope station
items.description: An expensive microscope with sample slides scattered around

items.name: pathogen sample slide
items.description: A glass slide with a contaminated sample

items.name: containment control room door
items.description: A reinforced door leading to the control room. A keycard reader blinks red.

rooms.name: Containment Control Room
rooms.description: The facility's command center. Banks of monitors display containment status across all zones. A large window overlooks the research laboratory below. Emergency lighting bathes everything in red. The emergency evacuation door glows green on the far wall, but it's sealed with a security panel requiring verification.

items.name: main control console
items.description: The primary control station with multiple screens and status displays
items.text: FACILITY STATUS: CRITICAL CONTAINMENT BREACH. Pathogen: Virus Strain X. Origin: Research Laboratory. All zones compromised. Emergency evacuation authorized. Director: Dr. Sarah Chen.

items.name: facility director's desk
items.description: Dr. Chen's desk covered with reports and emergency plans

items.name: director's personal log
items.description: Dr. Chen's private notes about the facility
items.text: Personal Log - Dr. Sarah Chen: The APEX Biocontainment Facility has served us well since 2047. But today, the Research Laboratory containment failed. Virus Strain X has breached. I'm sealing the emergency exit with security questions. Only authorized Research Scientists who know the facility can escape.

items.name: facility layout schematic
items.description: A detailed map of the entire facility
items.text: APEX BIOCONTAINMENT FACILITY LAYOUT: Decontamination Airlock (Entry), Research Laboratory (Pathogen Storage), Containment Control Room (Command Center), Emergency Evacuation Bay (Exit). Contamination source: Research Laboratory.

items.name: security camera monitor
items.description: Screens showing various areas of the facility
items.text: Camera feeds show the Research Laboratory in chaos, the source of the outbreak clearly visible in the broken containment units. The Emergency Evacuation Bay remains secure and uncontaminated.

items.name: emergency supply cabinet
items.description: A cabinet with emergency equipment and supplies

items.name: portable oxygen tank
items.description: A backup oxygen supply for emergencies

items.name: evacuation bay security door
items.description: The sealed emergency exit with a security verification panel. Three questions are displayed on the screen that must be answered correctly.

password_questions.question: What is the facility name?
password_questions.hint: Check the facility manual and various documents throughout the facility

password_questions.question: Where did the contamination originate?
password_questions.hint: Multiple sources mention where the pathogen breach occurred

password_questions.question: What is your role designation?
password_questions.hint: The wall terminal in the airlock identifies your position

rooms.name: Emergency Evacuation Bay
rooms.description: You've made it to safety! A clean, pressurized chamber with bright white lights and fresh filtered air. Decontamination systems spray you with cleansing mist. Through the large bay doors, you can see emergency vehicles and hazmat teams waiting outside. You're safe now.

items.name: automated decontamination system
items.description: Sprayers releasing cleansing mist to remove any contamination

items.name: emergency communication phone
items.description: A red phone connected to emergency response teams

items.name: large bay doors
items.description: Massive doors opening to the outside world and safety

rooms.win_message: SUCCESS! You've escaped the biohazard quarantine zone and reached the Emergency Evacuation Bay! The decontamination systems wash away any traces of contamination as emergency teams rush in to help. Thanks to your quick thinking and problem-solving skills, you survived the containment breach. The facility will be sealed, but you made it out alive. You win!
